gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: P. O. Box 3000

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Arctic Transitions in the Land-Atmosphere System (ATLAS) Project is a coordinated program that will examine the geographical patterns and controls over climate-land surface exchange and develop reasonable scenarios of future change in the Arctic. This CD is a compilation of information and measurements made at the Ivotuk site on the North Slope of Alaska by a hard working group of scientists and technicians. It contains data, pictures and descriptions for a 2 1/2 year period from 1998 through June 2000. The CD contents are online at the dataset homepage.
